description.narrative: This project aims to set the basis and determine the methodology and the institutional framework in which the National Development Strategy for the next two decades will be prepared in an open, inclusive and transparent procedure.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Methodology for NDS preparation and strategic planning outlined 1.2 Operational structure to facilitate NDS formulation process created and institutional arrangement for NDS implementation proposed 2.1 Strategic documents and reform processes relevant for NDS formulation identified 3.1 Stakeholders expectations and feedback identified and included into communication and engagement strategy 3.2 Digital platform for constructive dialogue between all relevant stakeholders for NDS formulation designed

comment.narrative: Lack of methodology and the institutional framework for preparation of National Development Strategy in an open, inclusive and transparent procedure.

1.1.1. Comparative analysis of strategic development planning processes and procedures in other countries and contemporary theory providing recommendations for the NDS development. 1.1.2. Methodological framework outlined and validated by key stakeholders and national authorities. 1.1.3. Stakeholders map. 1.1.4. Consultative workshops. 1.1.5. Operational structure with roles and responsibilities assigned. 1.1.6. Institutional arrangement for NDS implementation and monitoring prepared and proposed to national authorities. 2.1.1. Selected criteria for screening of national strategic documents. 2.1.2. Inventory of strategic documents and reform processes relevant for NDS. 2.1.3. Report on the Strategic Engagement of Local Governments in the Preparation of the NDS 2021 – 2041 [aligning local and regional with national development strategies] 2.1.4. Analysis of the complementarity of the EU accession process with the proposed NDS development process. 3.1.1. Tools and techniques identified to ensure active participation and stakeholders’ engagement in NDS preparation. 3.1.2. Surveys and interviews conducted to screen stakeholders’ expectations and set-up baseline for the NDS preparation process. 3.1.3. Communication and engagement strategy for stakeholders involvement outlined. 3.1.4. Range of digital communications products developed. 3.1.5. Identification of a software solution (based on comparative overview of existing Digital Public Engagement Platforms); 3.1.6. Digital platform that would enable wider community engagement, effective feedback, frequent consultations and collaborative NDS formulation designed. 3.1.7. Protocols for communication between institutional stakeholders defined.

1.1.1.1 comparative analysis of the relevant strategic and planning processes and procedures in 7 countries was developed that have created and implemented long term plans. This document provided not only a comprehensive analysis of these countries processes, but it also surfaced key lessons that need to inform the NDS writing process and structure in North Macedonia. 1.1.1.2 comparative analysis was presented among the UNDP operational team and the UN country teams, but also among key stakeholders including steering committee members, government officials that are part of the operational teams of the steering committee members, academia, cso’s and other relevant stakeholders in this process. 1.1.2.1 Outline of the methodological approach created by a team of international experts with a combination of local experts, and with instructions from the project operational team. 1.1.2.2 More than 10 co-design sessions were organized with various stakeholders, in order to develop the outline of the methodological approach, which was latter validated at a Steering Committee session by key stakeholders and national authorities. 1.1.3.1 Mapping and engaging key stakeholders performed by a local organization ‘European Policy Institute’ working alongside the international team of experts from the ‘Dark Matter Labs’ 1.1.3.2 Report on the stakeholders prepared comprising the following documents:  Stakeholders inventory list  Narrative report on the mapped stakeholders  Visual representation of the mapped stakeholders 1.1.3.3 stakeholder mapping presented and shared among the UNDP operational team and the UN country teams, but also among key stakeholders including steering committee members, government officials that are part of the operational teams of the steering committee members, academia, cso’s and other relevant stakeholders in this process. 1.1.4.1 More than 10 co-design sessions were organized with various stakeholders, in order to develop the outline of the methodological approach which incorporated the stakeholder mapping exercise. The methodological outline was then validated at a Steering Committee session by key stakeholders and national authorities. 1.1.5.1 Operational structure developed with roles and responsibilities assigned. 1.1.6.1 Institutional arrangement for NDS implementation and monitoring prepared and proposed to national authorities. 2.1.1.1 Team of experts mapped and analyzed 70 strategic documents, following a methodology that was developed for the purposes of this project, and was adopted by the UNDP operational team and our government partners in the process in four thematic areas: Economy and Public Finance, Environment and Energy, Social Policy and Good Governance, Rule of Law and Justice. 2.1.1.2 Country’s strategic goals and gaps were mapped 2.1.1.3 Report on the recommended criteria for identification and selection of strategic documents relevant for the development of the NDS in North Macedonia was prepared 2.1.2.1 Inventory of strategic documents built on the criteria for identification and selection of strategic documents as well as the comprehensive report has been prepared 2.1.2.2 Criteria for screening of national strategic documents were selected 2.1.2.3 Inventory of strategic documents and reform processes relevant for NDS was completed 2.1.3.1 Current local development plans and strategies and how they can be engaged and complement the existing NDS formulation process investigated 2.1.3.2 A tool that would allow to strategically engage local stakeholders in the NDS process adapted, using an existing methodology, 2.1.3.3 Report on the Strategic Engagement of Local Governments in the Preparation of the NDS 2021 – 2041 prepared aligning local and regional with national development strategies 2.1.4.1 A document on the analysis of the complementarity of the EU accession process with the proposed NDS development process prepared 3.1.1.1 A set of tools and technics to ensure active participation and stakeholders’ engagement in NDS preparation were identified 3.1.2.1. A representative survey for North Macedonia was developed and implemented, scanning citizens expectations about the NDS process, as well as their perceptions on public policymaking in the country. The representative survey was accompanied with focus groups focusing on women and marginalized communities to determine their in-depth perceptions about their inclusion in the public policymaking process. This process was spearheaded by a research company called ‘Indago’. 3.1.3.1. Communication and engagement strategy for stakeholder’s involvement was developed by the company GRAY. 3.1.4.1 The following communication products were prepared by the communications company ‘Futura’  One explainer video for the strategy and its development.  5 informational social media cards.  Web banners in 3 sizes.  Slideshow presentation for meetings.  Design of a factsheet. 3.1.5.1 Software solution based on comparative overview of existing Digital Public Engagement Platforms has been developed and following documents produced:  Identification of a software solution, power point presentation.  Identification of a software solution, written analysis.  Proposal for the development of a digital platform for the NDS process, as a written analysis. 3.1.6.1. Digital platform designed to enable wider community engagement, effective feedback, frequent consultations and collaborative NDS formulation and following documents were produced:  Comparative analysis of digital engagement platforms  Technical specifications and maintenance plan for the digital platform.  Video tutorial on the core elements of the digital platform. 3.1.7.1. Protocols for communication between institutional stakeholders were defined and produced.
